intro: Buphthalmum imbricatum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Buphthalmum imbricatum is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-resistant species.
